snippet.title: Johnny Depp Finally Responds to being Fired from Fantastic Beast Franchise
snippet.description:
Johnny Depp Finally Responds to being Fired from Fantastic Beast Franchise

In this video, Watchify explores the occasion of Johnny Depp finally breaking word and responding to being fired from the Fantastic Beast Franchise, a film made by David Yates. 

Depp was forced out from the franchise after losing his libel suit against The Sun, a British tabloid that referred to him as a "wife-beater" in a story referencing allegations he had assaulted his ex-wife Amber Heard.

"I mean, obviously, they were going to do the film, and obviously he was not involved anymore," Mikkelsen said of Depp in The Sunday Times. "But I didn't have a dog in that fight. And I don't know what happened [in his private life], and I don't know if it was fair, him losing the job, but I just knew that the show was going on, and I would've loved to have talked to him about it if I had the chance, but I just don't know him in that sense.

Mikkelsen is set to bring to life the dark wizard Gellert Grindelwald in the as-yet-unnamed third installment of the Harry Potter spin-off franchise. As far stepping into a new role that was already established prior by a different actor, Mikkelsen plans to make it his own.
